titlepage.titleproper: Inventory of the John Ehrlichman Papers, 1963-1982
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1999 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: John Ehrlichman Papers,
did.abstract: Photocopies of notes of White House meetings, memoranda, letters, and reports, relating primarily to Nixon administration domestic policy, policy relating to the Vietnam War, the 1972 presidential elections, and the Watergate controversy; and sound recordings of television news programs and interviews, Congressional hearings, and trial proceedings, relating to the Watergate affair. In part, photocopy.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Boxes 18-137 closed. The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], John Ehrlichman Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1988, with later increments.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

originalsloc.head: Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: In part, originals located in: National Archives, Washington, D.C.

chronitem.event: Partner, Hullin, Ehrlichman, Roberts & Hodge, Seattle, Washington
Director, Convention Activities; Tour Director, Nixon for President campaign
Assistant to the President for Domestic Affairs; Executive Director, Domestic Council
Member, President's Council on International Economic Policy
Inmate, Swift Trail Federal Prison Camp, Safford, Arizona

did.unittitle: NIXON ADMINISTRATION FILE, Appendix A - Documents: Files

scopecontent.p: Primarily meeting notes; also includes schedules, memoranda, letters, telephone notes, charts, reports and statements relating to domestic policy, Cabinet and Executive Department personnel, the Vietnam war (including the CBS-Westmoreland controversy over enemy force estimates), Watergate, and the 1972 presidential election. Arranged chronologically; see Appendix A for detailed box list (prepared by the Archives of Artists of New Mexico and the Southwest).

re: committee's procedural rules (Ervin/Baker phone), (7 pages)
Hunt & Liddy (Memo-Silbert to H. Petersen), broke in Ellsbergs psych., (1 page)
Macgruder-press (C. Colson phone), (5 pages)
Colson-W/G, notes of mtg. w/CC, (3 pages)
Ziegler delivers the message:, H & E must go (Ziegler), Dispute re what JBC says (H & E), (6 pages)
What JBC said, LEAVE OF ABSENCE (TT/H/E), JNM MAY LIE ABOUT E, ROGERS, H LISTEN TO TAPES OF TT/DEAN, Fire Dean-no immunity, Clemency, H Peterson-coddling Dean-wait, Leave for all, (12 pages)
Kleindienst resign, Richardson (Phone-Ziegler), Dean, Mitchell 4/15 or 4/16, Colson 4/16 - Dean, (8 pages)
re Ellsberg break in -, Did I know sooner? (TT/E), E-nod, TT: If so, I don't recall, (3 pages)
Reports, statements, charts, military cables, memoranda and letters relating to General William Westmoreland, CBS, and enemy force estimates during the Vietnam war,
AUDIOVISUAL FILE, Appendix B - John Ehrlichman Media Tapes Dating from 1/30/71 to 7/30/78,

scopecontent.p: Audiotapes relating to Watergate, primarily recordings of news broadcasts. Arranged chronologically; see Appendix B for detailed box list (prepared by the Archives of Artists of New Mexico and the Southwest).
